Run initialization type
entry.ldesc: Determines the model run initialization type. This setting is only important for the initial run of a production run when the CONTINUE_RUN variable is set to FALSE. After the initial run, the CONTINUE_RUN variable is set to TRUE, and the model restarts exactly using input files in a case, date, and bit-for-bit continuous fashion. Default: startup. -- In a startup run (the default), all components are initialized using baseline states. These baseline states are set independently by each component and can include the use of restart files, initial files, external observed data files, or internal initialization (i.e., a cold start). In a startup run, the coupler sends the start date to the components at initialization. In addition, the coupler does not need an input data file. In a startup initialization, the ocean model does not start until the second ocean coupling (normally the second day). -- In a branch run, all components are initialized using a consistent set of restart files from a previous run (determined by the RUN_REFCASE and RUN_REFDATE variables in env_run.xml). The case name is generally changed for a branch run, although it does not have to be. In a branch run, setting RUN_STARTDATE is ignored because the model components obtain the start date from their restart datasets. Therefore, the start date cannot be changed for a branch run. This is the same mechanism that is used for performing a restart run (where CONTINUE_RUN is set to TRUE in the env_run.xml) Branch runs are typically used when sensitivity or parameter studies are required, or when settings for history file output streams need to be modified while still maintaining bit-for-bit reproducibility. Under this scenario, the new case is able to produce an exact bit-for-bit restart in the same manner as a continuation run IF no source code or component namelist inputs are modified. All models use restart files to perform this type of run. RUN_REFCASE and RUN_REFDATE are required for branch runs. To set up a branch run, locate the restart tar file or restart directory for RUN_REFCASE and RUN_REFDATE from a previous run, then place those files in the RUNDIR directory. --- A hybrid run indicates that the model is initialized more like a startup, but uses initialization datasets FROM A PREVIOUS case. This is somewhat analogous to a branch run with relaxed restart constraints. A hybrid run allows users to bring together combinations of initial/restart files from a previous case (specified by RUN_REFCASE) at a given model output date (specified by RUN_REFDATE). Unlike a branch run, the starting date of a hybrid run (specified by RUN_STARTDATE) can be modified relative to the reference case. In a hybrid run, the model does not continue in a bit-for-bit fashion with respect to the reference case. The resulting climate, however, should be continuous provided that no model source code or namelists are changed in the hybrid run. In a hybrid initialization, the ocean model does not start until the second ocean coupling (normally the second day), and the coupler does a cold start without a restart file.

Only used for C,G compsets: if ocn, ocn provides EP balance factor for precip
entry.ldesc: Provides EP balance factor for precip for POP. A factor computed by POP is applied to precipitation so that precipitation balances evaporation and ocn global salinity does not drift. This is intended for use when coupling POP to a DATM. Only used for C and G compsets. Default is off.

entry.sdesc: Only used for C,G compsets: if true, compute albedos to work with daily avg SW down
entry.ldesc: If false, albedos are computed with the assumption that downward solar radiation from the atm component has a diurnal cycle and zenith-angle dependence. This is normally the case when using an active atm component If true, albedos are computed with the assumption that downward solar radiation from the atm component is a daily average quantity and does not have a zenith-angle dependence. This is often the case when using a data atm component. This is only used for C and G compsets. Default is false.

entry.sdesc: BGC flag
entry.ldesc: If the value is not none, the coupler is compiled so that optional BGC related fields are exchanged between component models. Currently only none and CO2A are supported. CO2A will activate sending diagnostic and prognostic co2 from the atm component to the lnd component.

entry.sdesc: Glacier model number of elevation classes, 0 implies no glacier land unit in clm
entry.ldesc: Used by both CLM and CISM (even if CISM is not running, and only SGLC is used)

entry.sdesc: Whether the glacier component feeds back to the rest of the system
entry.ldesc:
This affects: (1) Whether CLM updates its areas based on glacier areas sent from GLC (2) Whether GLC sends fluxes (e.g., calving fluxes) to the coupler
Note that this is set to TRUE by default for TG compsets - even though there are no feedbacks for TG compsets, this enables extra coupler diagnostics for these compsets.

entry.sdesc: CO2 ppmv
entry.ldesc: This set the namelist values of CO2 ppmv for CAM and CLM. This variables is introduced to coordinate this value among multiple components.

entry.sdesc: enable papi hardware counters
entry.ldesc: Enables the papi hardware counters in gptl The papi library must be included in the build step for this to work.

entry.sdesc: CAM configure options, see CAM configure utility for details
entry.ldesc: Provides option(s) for the CAM configure utility. CAM_CONFIG_OPTS are normally set as compset variables (e.g., -phys cam3_5_1 -chem waccm_mozart) and in general should not be modified for supported compsets. It is recommended that if you want to modify this value for your experiment, you should use your own user-defined component sets via using create_newcase with a compset_file argument.

entry.sdesc: CAM dynamical core
CAM namelist use_case
entry.ldesc: Provides the use_case option for the CAM build-namelist utility (which is called from $CASEROOT/Buildconf/cam.buildnml). The CAM build-namelist leverages groups of namelist options (use cases) that are often paired with the CAM configure options. These use cases are xml files located in $CIMEROOT/../components/atm/cam/bld/namelist_files/use_cases. In general, this variable should not be modified for supported component sets (compsets). Recommendation: If you want to modify this value for your experiment, use your own user-defined component sets.

entry.sdesc: CAM specific namelist settings for -namelist option
entry.ldesc: Provides options to the -namelist argument for the CAM build-namelist utility (see above). This should be reserved for component set specification. Users should modify CAM namelists only via the $CASEROOT/user_nl_cam file

entry.sdesc: CLM configure options
entry.ldesc: Provides option(s) for the CLM configure utility. CLM_CONFIG_OPTS are normally set as compset variables (e.g., -bgc cn) and in general should not be modified for supported compsets. It is recommended that if you want to modify this value for your experiment, you should use your own user-defined component sets via using create_newcase with a compset_file argument. This is an advanced flag and should only be used by expert users.

entry.sdesc: CLM build-namelist options
CLM namelist use_case
entry.ldesc: Determines the use-case that will be sent to the CLM build-namelist utility. This is normally set by the component set. This is an advanced flag and should only be used by expert users.

entry.sdesc: CLM specific namelist settings
entry.ldesc: CLM-specific namelist settings for -namelist option in the CLM build-namelist. CLM_NAMELIST_OPTS is normally set as a compset variable and in general should not be modified for supported compsets. It is recommended that if you want to modify this value for your experiment, you should use your own user-defined component sets via using create_newcase with a compset_file argument. This is an advanced flag and should only be used by expert users.

entry.sdesc: clm co2 type
entry.ldesc: Determines how CLM will determine where CO2 is set. If value is constant, it will be set to CCSM_CO2_PPMV, if value is either diagnostic or prognostic, the atmosphere model MUST send it to CLM. CLM_CO2_TYPE is normally set by the specific compset, since it HAS to be coordinated with settings for the atmospheric model. Do not modify this variable. If you want to modify for your experiment, use your own user-defined component set This is an advanced flag and should only be used by expert users.

entry.sdesc: Force CLM model to do a cold-start
entry.ldesc: Flag to the CLM build-namelist command to force CLM to do a cold start (finidat will be set to blanks). A value of on forces the model to spin up from a cold-start (arbitrary initial conditions). Setting this value in the xml file will take precedence over any settings for finidat in the $CASEROOT/user_clm_clm file.

entry.sdesc: My Data ID
entry.ldesc: Dataset name for user-created datasets. This is used as the argument in Buildconf/clm.buildnml to build-namelist -clm_usr_name. An example of such a dataset would be 1x1pt_boulderCO_c090722. The default value is UNSET. This is an advanced flag and should only be used by expert users.

entry.sdesc: TRUE implies CLM is built with support for the PETSc library
entry.ldesc: The Variably Saturated Flow Model (VSFM) solver in CLM uses the PETSc library. In order to use the VSFM solver, CLM must be built with PETSc support and linking to PETSc must occur when building the ACME executable. This occurs if this variable is set to TRUE. Note that is only available on a limited set of machines/compilers.

entry.sdesc: VIC configure options
VIC namelist use_case
VIC specific namelist settings
vic co2 type
Force VIC model to do a cold-start
VIC Single point name
My Data ID
mode for rtm model, NULL means rtm is turned off
mode for rtm flood feature, NULL means rtm flood is turned off
RTM build-namelist options
RTM specific namelist settings
entry.ldesc: RTM-specific namelist settings in the RTM build-namelist. RTM_NAMELIST_OPTS is normally set as a compset variable and in general should not be modified for supported compsets. It is recommended that if you want to modify this value for your experiment, you should use your own user-defined component sets via using create_newcase with a compset_file argument.

entry.sdesc: Option to the CICE configure utility for the -mode argument (default is prognostic)
CICE configure options, see CICE configure utility for details
entry.ldesc: Provides option(s) for the CLM configure utility. CICE_CONFIG_OPTS are normally set as compset variables (e.g., -ntr_aero 3) and in general should not be modified for supported compsets. It is recommended that if you want to modify this value for your experiment, you should use your own user-defined component sets via using create_newcase with a compset_file argument. This is an advanced flag and should only be used by expert users.

entry.sdesc: CICE specific namelist settings for -namelist option
if false, user must set the CICE decomp, otherwise cesm_setup script sets it
entry.ldesc: This is for experts only - if CICE_AUTO_DECOMP is set to false, then can manually set the values of CICE_BLCKX, CICE_BLCKY, CICE_MXBLCKS, CICE_DECOMPTYPE, and CICE_DECOMPSETTING

entry.sdesc: Size of cice block in first horiz dimension (do not edit if CICE_AUTO_DECOMP is true)
entry.ldesc: This is for experts only - automatically set if CICE_AUTO_DECOMP is true, to set this value, must first set CICE_AUTO_DECOMP to false

entry.sdesc: Size of cice block in second horiz dimension (do not edit if CICE_AUTO_DECOMP is true)
entry.ldesc: This is for experts only - automatically set if CICE_AUTO_DECOMP is true, to set this value, must first set CICE_AUTO_DECOMP to false

entry.sdesc: Max number of cice blocks per processor (do not edit if CICE_AUTO_DECOMP is true)
entry.ldesc: This is for experts only - automatically set if CICE_AUTO_DECOMP is true, to set this value, must first set CICE_AUTO_DECOMP to false

entry.sdesc: cice block distribution type (do not edit if CICE_AUTO_DECOMP is true)
entry.ldesc: This is for experts only - automatically set if CICE_AUTO_DECOMP is true, to set this value, must first set CICE_AUTO_DECOMP to false

entry.sdesc: cice decomp setting for decomp type (do not edit if CICE_AUTO_DECOMP is true)
entry.ldesc: This is for experts only - automatically set if CICE_AUTO_DECOMP is true, to set this value, must first set CICE_AUTO_DECOMP to false

entry.sdesc: CICE cpp definitions (setup automatically - DO NOT EDIT)
surface heat and freshwater forcing, partial is consistent with coupling to a data atm model
entry.ldesc: Determine surface freshwater and heat forcing settings. The full option yields settings that are appropriate for coupling to an active atmospheric model (e.g., a B-type compset). The partial option yields settings that are appropriate for coupling to a data atmospheric model (e.g., a C or G-type compset). The create_newcase command selects the appropriate setting for this variable based on the specified compset. Users should NOT EDIT this setting.

entry.sdesc: under ice forcing, inactive is consistent with coupling to a data ice model
entry.ldesc: Determine under-ice forcing settings. The active option yields settings that are appropriate for coupling to an active ice model (e.g., a B or G-type compset). The inactive option yields settings that are appropriate for coupling to a data ice model (e.g., a C-type compset). The create_newcase command selects the appropriate setting for this variable based on the specified compset. Users should NOT EDIT this setting.

entry.sdesc: provenance of surface Chl for radiative penetration computations
entry.ldesc: Determines provenance of surface Chl for radiative penetration computations. This option is used in the POP ecosystem model. The default is diagnostic.

entry.sdesc: provenance of atmospheric CO2 for gas flux computation
entry.ldesc: Determines provenance of atmospheric CO2 for gas flux computation. This option is used in the POP ecosystem model. The default is constant.

entry.sdesc: TRUE implies using fix to pH scale of carbon thermodynamic constants
specification of transient forcing datasets
entry.ldesc: Determine settings for transient forcing datasets (e.g., atmospheric pCFC concentrations). The create_newcase command selects the appropriate setting for this variable based on the specified compset. This option is used in the POP ecosystem model. Users should NOT EDIT this setting.

entry.sdesc: Optional ocean submodel option. Any one of: moby
Optional ocean tracers. Valid values are Any combination of: iage cfc ecosys
Optional ocean tracers option. Any one of: darwin quota mono
tavg output control for tracer-budget terms
tavg output control for high-frequency output
TRUE turns off all horizontal motion in POP
If TRUE then time-averaged history files from POP will contain double precision output
if false, user must set the POP decomp, otherwise cesm_setup script sets it
Size of pop block in first horiz dimension (do not edit if POP_AUTO_DECOMP is true)
Size of pop block in second horiz dimension (do not edit if POP_AUTO_DECOMP is true)
Number of pop blocks in first horiz dimension (do not edit if POP_AUTO_DECOMP is true)
Number of pop blocks in second horiz dimension (do not edit if POP_AUTO_DECOMP is true)
Max number of pop blocks per processor (do not edit if POP_AUTO_DECOMP is true)
pop block distribution type (do not edit if POP_AUTO_DECOMP is true)
POP cpp definitions (setup automatically - DO NOT EDIT)
TRUE implies CISM is built with support for the trilinos library
entry.ldesc: When using the higher-order dynamical cores in CISM, one option is to use the trilinos solver library for sparse matrix solves. In order to exercise that option, you need to build CISM with trilinos support, and link to the trilinos libraries when building the CESM executable. Setting this variable to TRUE accomplishes these things. Note that you can set this to TRUE and still choose not to use the trilinos solvers for the sparse matrix solves. Also, note that trilinos is only available on a limited set of machines; this must remain FALSE to run CISM on a machine that does not have trilinos, or for which the CESM scripts are not aware of the existence of trilinos.

entry.sdesc: Version of CISM physics/dynamics to use
For hybrid runs, whether CISM should use observed initial conditions instead of restart file
entry.ldesc: For hybrid runs, a value of FALSE (default) implies that CISM should use the restart file from the reference case; a value of TRUE implies that CISM should instead use the observed initial conditions that are generally used for startup runs. This variable is ignored for startup runs; for branch runs, it MUST BE FALSE.

entry.sdesc: true => do surface mass balance, false => PDD, nec_glc is set to 1
MPASLI configure options
entry.ldesc: Currently not used

entry.sdesc: TRUE implies MPASLI is built with support for the Albany library
entry.ldesc: The first-order velocity solver in MPASLI uses the Albany library. In order to use that velocity solver, MPASLI must be built with Albany support and linking to Albany must occur when building the ACME executable. This occurs if this variable is set to TRUE. Note that is only available on a limited set of machines/compilers. This must remain FALSE to run MPASLI on a machine that does not have Albany, or for which the CIME scripts are not aware of the existence of Albany.

entry.sdesc: true => have LND calculate surface mass balance
DATM mode
entry.ldesc: Mode for data atmosphere component. The default is CORE2_NYF (CORE2 normal year forcing) is the DATM mode used in C and G compsets. CLM_QIAN, CLMCRUNCEP and CLM1PT are modes using observational data for forcing CLM in I compsets.

entry.sdesc: DATM CO2 time series
DATM prescribed aerosol forcing
year align (only used for CLM_QIAN mode)
starting year to loop data over (only used for CLM_QIAN mode)
entry.ldesc: For I compset only. Starting year to loop data over for CLM_QIAN mode. Default value is 2004.

entry.sdesc: ending year to loop data over (only used for CLM_QIAN mode)
entry.ldesc: For I compset only. Ending year to loop data over for CLM_QIAN mode. Default value is 2004.

entry.sdesc: case name for coupler history data mode (only used for CPLHIST3HrWx mode)
year align (only used for CPLHIST3HrWx mode)
entry.ldesc: For I compset only. Year align (simulation year corresponding to starting year) for CLM_QIAN mode. Default value is 1.

entry.sdesc: starting year to loop data over (only used for CPLHIST3HrWx mode)
ending year to loop data over (only used for CPLHIST3HrWx mode)
DICE mode
entry.ldesc: DICE is a combination of a data model and a prognostic model. The data functionality reads in ice coverage. The prognostic functionality calculates the ice/atmosphere and ice/ocean fluxes. DICE receives the same atmospheric input from the coupler as the active CICE model (i.e., atmospheric states, shortwave fluxes, and ocean ice melt flux). DICE acts very similarly to CICE running in prescribed mode.) Currently, this component is only used to drive POP in C compsets. If DICE_MODE is set to ssmi or ssmi_iaf, it is a prognostic mode. It requires data be sent to the ice model. Ice fraction (extent) data is read from an input stream, atmosphere state variables are received from the coupler, and then an atmosphere-ice surface flux is computed and sent to the coupler. Normally the ice fraction data is found in the same data files that provide SST data to the data ocean model. They are normally found in the same file because the SST and ice fraction data are derived from the same observational data sets and are consistent with each other.

entry.sdesc: DOCN mode
entry.ldesc: The data ocean component (DOCN) always returns SSTs to the driver. The atmosphere/ocean fluxes are computed in the coupler. Therefore, the data ocean model does not compute fluxes like the data ice model. DOCN has two distinct modes of operation. It can arun as a pure data model, reading in ocean SSTs (normally climatological) from input datasets, performing time/spatial interpolations, and passing these to the coupler. Alternatively, DOCN can compute updated SSTs by running as a slab ocean model where bottom ocean heat flux convergence and boundary layer depths are read in and used with the atmosphere/ocean and ice/ocean fluxes obtained from the driver. --- A setting of prescribed assumes the only field in the input stream is SST. It also assumes the SST is in Celsius and must be converted to Kelvin. All other fields are set to zero except for ocean salinity, which is set to a constant reference salinity value. Normally the ice fraction data is found in the same data files that provide SST data to the data ocean model. They are normally found in the same file because the SST and ice fraction data are derived from the same observational data sets and are consistent with each other. to the data ocean model. They are normally found in the same file because the SST and ice fraction data are derived from the same observational data sets and are consistent with each other. --- A setting of som (slab ocean model) mode is a prognostic mode. This mode computes a prognostic sea surface temperature and a freeze/melt potential (surface Q-flux) used by the sea ice model. This calculation requires an external SOM forcing data file that includes ocean mixed layer depths and bottom-of-the-slab Q-fluxes. Scientifically appropriate bottom-of-the-slab Q-fluxes are normally ocean resolution dependent and are derived from the ocean model output of a fully coupled CCSM run. Note that while this mode runs out of the box, the default SOM forcing file is not scientifically appropriate and is provided for testing and development purposes only. Users must create scientifically appropriate data for their particular application. A tool is available to derive valid SOM forcing. Default is prescribed.

entry.sdesc: Sets SOM forcing data filename for pres runs, only used in D and E compset
entry.ldesc: Sets SOM forcing data filename for pres runs, only used in D and E compset

entry.sdesc: valid values: CPLHIST,DIATREN_ANN_RX1,DIATREN_IAF_RX1,NULL
entry.ldesc: DROF mode. Values are CPLHIST, *_RX1, and NULL. In *_RX1 mode, observational climatological or interannual 1-degree runoff data is used. In CPLHIST mode, runoff data from a previous model run is read in. In NULL mode, the runoff data is set to zero. In CPLHIST mode, land forcing data from a previous model run is output by the coupler and read in by the data land model. In NULL mode, land forcing is set to zero and not used. The default is DIATREN_ANN_RX1.

entry.sdesc: directory for coupler history data mode (only used for CPLHIST mode)
case name for coupler history data mode (only used for CPLHIST mode)
year align (only used for CPLHIST mode)
starting year to loop data over (only used for CPLHIST mode)
ending year to loop data over (only used for CPLHIST mode)
valid values: CPLHIST,GLC_CPLHIST,NULL
entry.ldesc: DLND mode. Valid values are CPLHIST, GLC_CPLHIST and NULL. In CPLHIST mode, land forcing data (produced by CLM) from a previous model run is output in coupler history files and read in by the data land model. IN GLC_CPLHIST, glc coupling fields are read in from a coupler history file. In NULL mode, land forcing is set to zero and not utilized. The default is NULL.

entry.sdesc: directory for coupler history data mode (only used for CPLHIST mode)
case name for coupler history data mode (only used for CPLHIST mode)
year align (only used for CPLHIST mode)
starting year to loop data over (only used for CPLHIST mode)
ending year to loop data over (only used for CPLHIST mode)
mode for xrof flood feature, NULL means xrof flood is turned off
Prescribed SST and ice coverage stream name.
entry.ldesc:
Sets SST and ice coverage stream name for prescribed runs.
Only used in F and A compsets.

entry.sdesc: Prescribed SST and ice coverage data file name.
entry.ldesc:
Sets SST and ice coverage data file name for prescribed runs.
Only used in F and A compsets.

entry.sdesc: Prescribed SST and ice coverage grid file name.
entry.ldesc:
Sets SST and ice coverage grid file name for prescribed runs.
Only used in F and A compsets.

entry.sdesc: The model year that corresponds to SSTICE_YEAR_START on the data file.
entry.ldesc:
Prescribed SST and ice coverage data will be aligned so that the first year of data corresponds to SSTICE_YEAR_ALIGN in the model. For instance, if the first year of prescribed data is the same as the first year of the model run, this should be set to the year given in RUN_STARTDATE.
If SSTICE_YEAR_ALIGN is later than the model's starting year, or if the model is run after the prescribed data ends (as determined by SSTICE_YEAR_END), the default behavior is to assume that the data from SSTICE_YEAR_START to SSTICE_YEAR_END cyclically repeats. This behavior is controlled by the "taxmode" stream option; see the data model documentation for more details.
Only used in F and A compsets.

entry.sdesc: The first year of data to use from SSTICE_DATA_FILENAME.
entry.ldesc:
This is the first year of prescribed SST and ice coverage data to use. For example, if a data file has data for years 0-99, and SSTICE_YEAR_START is 10, years 0-9 in the file will not be used.
Only used in F and A compsets.

entry.sdesc: The last year of data to use from SSTICE_DATA_FILENAME.
entry.ldesc:
This is the last year of prescribed SST and ice coverage data to use. For example, if a data file has data for years 0-99, and SSTICE_YEAR_END is 49, years 50-99 in the file will not be used.
Only used in F and A compsets.

stride of mpi tasks for atm comp - currently should always be set to 1
stride of mpi tasks for lnd comp - currently should always be set to 1
stride of mpi tasks for ice comp - currently should always be set to 1
stride of mpi tasks for ocn comp - currently should always be set to 1
stride of mpi tasks for cpl comp - currently should always be set to 1
stride of mpi tasks for glc comp - currently should always be set to 1
stride of mpi tasks for rof comp - currently should always be set to 1
stride of mpi tasks for wav comp - currently should always be set to 1
total number of tasks and threads (setup automatically - DO NOT EDIT)
pes level determined by automated initialization (DO NOT EDIT)
maximum number of tasks/ threads allowed per node (integer)
pes or cores per node for accounting purposes (integer)
mpi run command
pes or cores used relative to PES_PER_NODE for accounting (0 means TOTALPES is valid)
cost relative to 64 pes (DO NOT EDIT)
relative cost of test where ERS is 1 (DO NOT EDIT)
relative total cost of case (DO NOT EDIT)
scratch root directory for each machine. For now, primarily used for shared library builds
entry.ldesc: The CESM 'scratchroot' root directory. Base diretory for build and run directories.

entry.sdesc: case executable root directory (executable is $EXEROOT/cesm.exe, component libraries are in $EXEROOT/bld)
entry.ldesc: The CESM executable root directory. This is where the model builds its executable and by default runs the executable. Note that EXEROOT needs to have enough disk space for the experimental configuration requirements. As an example, CESM can produce more than a terabyte of data during a 100-year run, so you should set EXEROOT to scratch or tmp space and frequently back up the data to a mass storage device EXEROOT is set in $CIMEROOT/machines/config_machines.xml for each supported machine. Must explicitly set it in env_build.xml for a userdefined machine.

entry.sdesc: operating system - DO NOT EDIT UNLESS for userdefined machine - ignored once Macros has been created
machine compiler (must match one the supported compilers) - ignored once Macros has been created
entry.ldesc: Set in $CIMEROOT/machines/config_machines.xml for each machine.

entry.sdesc: Machine compiler (must match one the supported compilers)
entry.ldesc: Set in $CIMEROOT/machines/config_machines.xml for each supported machine. Must be explicitly set in env_build.xml for userdefined machine.

entry.sdesc: supported mpi libraries for target machine - set in config_machines.xml - (DO NOT EDIT)
entry.ldesc: Set in $CIMEROOT/machines/config_machines.xml for each supported machine. Must be explicitly set in env_build.xml for userdefined machine.

entry.sdesc: email address of person (or group) that supports the build and port for this machine (do not edit)
mpi library (must match one of the supported libraries) - ignored once Macros has been created
entry.ldesc: Set in $CIMEROOT/machines/config_machines.xml for each supported machine. Must be explicitly set in env_build.xml for userdefined machine.

entry.sdesc: PIO configure options, see PIO configure utility for details
calendar type
use MCT or ESMF component interfaces
TRUE implies using the ESMF library specified by ESMF_LIBDIR or ESMFMKFILE
TRUE implies turning on run and compile time debugging
entry.ldesc: Flag to turn on debugging for run time and compile time. If TRUE, compile-time debugging flags are activated that you can use to verify software robustness, such as bounds checking. Important:: On IBM machines, floating point trapping is not activated for production runs (i.e., non-DEBUG), due to performance penalties associated with turning on these flags. The default is FALSE.

entry.sdesc: TRUE implies always build model for openmp capability
entry.ldesc: If FALSE, component libraries are built with OpenMP capability only if the NTHREADS_ setting for that component is greater than 1 in env_mach_pes.xml. If TRUE, the component libraries are always built with OpenMP capability. The default is FALSE.

entry.sdesc: TRUE implies linking to the PETSc library - set automatically by XXX_USE_PETSC options (do not edit)
entry.ldesc: Flag to turn on linking to the PETSc library. Currently this is used by CLM. This is currently only supported for certain machines.

entry.sdesc: TRUE implies linking to the trilinos library - set automatically by XXX_USE_TRILINOS options (do not edit)
entry.ldesc: Flag to turn on linking to the trilinos library. Currently this is used by CISM. Note that trilinos is a C++ library, so setting this variable to TRUE will involve the inclusion of C++ code in the CESM executable. This is currently only supported for certain machines.

entry.sdesc: TRUE implies linking to the Albany library - set automatically by XXX_USE_ALBANY options (do not edit)
entry.ldesc: Flag to turn on linking to the Albany library. Currently this is used by MPASLI. Note that Albany is a C++ library, so setting this variable to TRUE will involve the inclusion of C++ code in the MPASLI executable. This is currently only supported for certain machines.

entry.sdesc: GNU make command
Number of processors for gmake
Status output: if TRUE, models have been built successfully. (DO NOT EDIT)
Status: smp status of previous build, coded string. (DO NOT EDIT)
Status: smp status of current case, coded string (DO NOT EDIT)
Status: ninst status of previous build, coded string. (DO NOT EDIT)
Status: ninst status of current case, coded string (DO NOT EDIT)
Status: of prior build. (DO NOT EDIT)
case build directory (set automatically to $EXEROOT, - DO NOT EDIT)
case lib directory (set automatically to $EXEROOT/lib - DO NOT EDIT)
case lib include directory (set automatically to $EXEROOT/lib/include - DO NOT EDIT)
Shared library root, (set automatically to $EXEROOT - DO NOT EDIT)
Shared library root directory, neeed for cleaning shared builds (set automatically to $EXEROOT - DO NOT EDIT)
Perl 5 library directory
The batch system type for this particular machine
The mpi run command associated with the machine configured batch system
The module system type defined for this machine
The module initialization path for module system defined for this machine
The module command path for module system defined for this machine
case run directory (by default will be set to $EXEROOT/../run)
entry.ldesc: The directory where the executable will be run. By default this is set to EXEROOT/../run. RUNDIR allows you to keep the run directory separate from the build directory.

entry.sdesc: Version name of CIME repository tag
Operate on only a single point of the global grid - DO NOT EDIT (for experts only)
Latitude to find nearest points for points mode (only used if PTS_MODE is TRUE)
Longitude to find nearest points for points mode (only used if PTS_MODE is TRUE)
CCSM tag
case description
logical that turns on diagnostic budgets
Turns on component varying thread control in the driver
Turns on component barriers for component timing
turns on bit-for-bit reproducibility with varying pe counts in coupler
level of debug output, 0=minimum, 1=normal, 2=more, 3=too much
timer output detail
timer output depth
number of timing output checkpoints
system workload snapshot frequency
entry.ldesc: system workload snapshot frequency (in seconds, if greater than 0; disabled otherwise)

entry.sdesc: base period associated with NCPL coupling frequency
number of atm coupling intervals per NCPL_BASE_PERIOD (integer)
number of land coupling intervals per NCPL_BASE_PERIOD (integer)
number of ice coupling intervals per NCPL_BASE_PERIOD (integer)
number of ocn coupling intervals per NCPL_BASE_PERIOD (integer)
number of glc coupling intervals per NCPL_BASE_PERIOD (integer)
number of rof coupling intervals per NCPL_BASE_PERIOD (integer)
number of wav coupling intervals per NCPL_BASE_PERIOD (integer)
coupler sequencing option
entry.ldesc: coupler sequencing option. CESM1_ORIG is the cesm1.1 implementation. CESM!_MOD includes a cesm1.3 mod that swaps ocean merging and atm/ocn flux computation. RASM_OPTION1 runs prep ocean before the ocean coupling reducing most of the lags and field inconsistency but still allowing the ocean to run concurrently with the ice and atmosphere. RASM_OPTION2 is similar to RASM_OPTION1 but sequences the ice model, prep ocean and ocean model in that order. The ocean model loses some of the concurrency with the ice model. CESM1_ORIG_TIGHT and CESM1_MOD_TIGHT are consistent with the old variables ocean_tight_coupling = true in the driver. That namelist is gone and the cpl_seq_option flags take it's place. TIGHT coupling makes no sense with the OPTION5 and OPTION6 flags.

entry.sdesc: directory where log files should be copied
entry.ldesc: Extra copies of the component log files will be saved here.

entry.sdesc: command used to query batch system
command used to submit to batch system
Batch redirect character
local inputdata directory for CCSM prestaged data
entry.ldesc: The root directory of CESM input data for the selected machine. This is usually a shared disk area. Default values for the target machine are in the $CIMEROOT/machines/config_machines.xml

entry.sdesc: general ccsm inputdata directory for CLM datm forcing
entry.ldesc: CLM-specific root directory for CLM type input forcing data. This directory will only be used for I (CLM/DATM) compsets and only for datm forcing data that is NOT checked into the svn repository (datasets other than the Qian or single-point forcing). This is usually a shared disk area. Default values for the target machine are in the $CIMEROOT/machines/config_machines.xml

entry.sdesc: logical to turn on short term archiving
entry.ldesc: If TRUE, short term archiving will be turned on. (default is TRUE)

entry.sdesc: local short term archiving root directory
entry.ldesc: Root directory for short term archiving. This directory must be visible to compute nodes.

entry.sdesc: logical to archive all interim restart files, not just those at eor
entry.ldesc: If TRUE, perform short term archiving on all interim restart files, not just those at the end of the run. By default, this value is FALSE. The restart files are saved under the specific component directory ($DOUT_S_ROOT/$CASE/$COMPONENT/rest rather than the top-level $DOUT_S_ROOT/$CASE/rest directory). Interim restart files are created using the REST_N and REST_OPTION variables. This is for expert users ONLY and requires expert knowledge. We will not document this further in this guide.

entry.sdesc: Save every Nth set of restart files and delete all others
entry.ldesc: If value is greater than 0, then only save the nth restart set in the $DOUT_S_ROOT/$CASE/rest location. Always preserve the most recent restart set regardless.

entry.sdesc: logical to save contents of the short term archive on disk
entry.ldesc: If TRUE, create hardlinks from the short term archive $DOUT_S_ROOT.locked/$CASE directory to the $DOUT_S_ROOT/$CASE directory.

entry.sdesc: logical to generate time-series files from the history time-slice files
entry.ldesc: If TRUE, create the single variable time series files using the history time slice files. All the time invariant metadata is included in each variable time series file header. Rules for how the tseries files are created are specified in the env_archive.xml file.

entry.sdesc: logical to save history time slice files after the variable time series have been generated
entry.ldesc: If TRUE, none of the history time slice files will be deleted from the $DOUT_S_ROOT/$CASE location after the variable time series files are successfully generated. *WARNING* setting this option to TRUE can more than double the disk space used by the output data for a given job.

entry.sdesc: logical to turn on long term archiving (if DOUT_S is also TRUE)
entry.ldesc: If TRUE, perform long-term archiving on the output data. Default is FALSE

entry.sdesc: local long term archiving root directory
entry.ldesc: Root directory on long term archiving store system for long-term data archives.

entry.sdesc: hpss account number
logical to tar up long term archiver history files
entry.ldesc: If true, DOUT_L_HTAR the long-term archiver will store history data in annual tar files. Default is FALSE. Not currently implemented.

entry.sdesc: logical to save contents of the short term archive on disk after the long term archiver has successfully completed
entry.ldesc: If TRUE, this keeps the output data in DOUT_S_ROOT on disk after the long term (lt_archive.sh) archiver is run.

entry.sdesc: cpl decomp option
standard ccsm baselines directory for testing
standard location of the cprnc tool
sets the run length with STOP_N and STOP_DATE (must be nyear(s) for _GLC compsets for restarts to work properly)
entry.ldesc: Ending simulation time (character) (must be nyear(s) for _GLC compsets for restarts to work properly)

entry.sdesc: sets the run length with STOP_OPTION and STOP_DATE
entry.ldesc: Provides a numerical count for $STOP_OPTION. (integer)

entry.sdesc: date in yyyymmdd format, sets the run length with STOP_OPTION and STOP_N
entry.ldesc: Alternative yyyymmdd date option, negative value implies off. (integer)

entry.sdesc: sets frequency of model restart writes (same options as STOP_OPTION) (must be nyear(s) for _GLC compsets)
entry.ldesc: Restart write interval. valid varlues: none,never,nsteps,nstep,nseconds,nsecond,nminutes,nminute,nhours,nhour,ndays,nday,nmonths,nmonth,nyears,nyear,date,ifdays0,end (must be nyear(s) for _GLC compsets)

entry.sdesc: sets model restart writes with REST_OPTION and REST_DATE
entry.ldesc: Number of intervals to write a restart. (integer)

entry.sdesc: date in yyyymmdd format, sets model restart write date with REST_OPTION and REST_N
entry.ldesc: Alternative yyyymmdd date option, negative value implies off. (integer)

entry.sdesc: sets coupler snapshot history file frequency (like REST_OPTION)
sets coupler snapshot history file frequency (like REST_N)
yyyymmdd format, sets coupler snapshot history date (like REST_DATE)
sets coupler average history file frequency (like REST_OPTION)
sets coupler average history file frequency (like REST_N)
yyyymmdd format, sets coupler average history date (like REST_DATE)
A setting of TRUE implies a continuation run
entry.ldesc: When you first begin a branch, hybrid or startup run, CONTINUE_RUN must be set to FALSE. When you successfully run and get a restart file, you will need to change CONTINUE_RUN to TRUE for the remainder of your run. This variable determines if the run is a restart run. Set to FALSE when initializing a startup, branch or hybrid case. Set to TRUE when continuing a run. (logical)

entry.sdesc: If RESUBMIT is greater than 0, then case will automatically resubmit
entry.ldesc: Enables the model to automatically resubmit a new run. To get multiple runs, set RESUBMIT greater than 0, then RESUBMIT will be decremented and the case will be resubmitted. The case will stop automatically resubmitting when the RESUBMIT value reaches 0. Long runs can easily outstrip supercomputer queue time limits. For this reason, a case is usually run as a series of jobs, each restarting where the previous finished.

logical to call the OMWG diagnostics plotting packages as part of the CESM run script after the successful completion of the short term archiver
entry.ldesc: If TRUE, this calls the OMWG diagnostics package parallel python wrapper script to generate climatological plots associated with the run job output. See the OMWG diagnostics documentation for more details.

entry.sdesc: logical to call the AMWG diagnostics plotting packages as part of the CESM run script after the successful completion of the short term archiver
entry.ldesc: If TRUE, this calls the AMWG diagnostics package parallel python wrapper script to generate climatological plots associated with the run job output. See the AMWG diagnostics documentation for more details.

entry.sdesc: logical to call the LMWG diagnostics plotting packages as part of the CESM run script after the successful completion of the short term archiver
entry.ldesc: If TRUE, this calls the LMWG diagnostics package parallel python wrapper script to generate climatological plots associated with the run job output. See the LMWG diagnostics documentation for more details.

entry.sdesc: logical to call the PCWG diagnostics plotting packages as part of the CESM run script after the successful completion of the short term archiver
entry.ldesc: If TRUE, this calls the PCWG diagnostics package parallel python wrapper script to generate climatological plots associated with the run job output. See the PCWG diagnostics documentation for more details.

entry.sdesc: post processing python virtual environment path location relative to the SRCROOT
entry.ldesc: Path to the post processing python virtual environment created by the create_python_env.sh script in the postprocessing directory. The create_python_env.sh script is run once per CESM source code installation.

entry.sdesc: logical to generate time-series files from the history time-slice files
entry.ldesc: If TRUE, create the single variable time series files using the history time slice files. All the time invariant metadata is included in each variable time series file header. Rules for how the tseries files are created are specified in the env_archive.xml file.

entry.sdesc: logical to call the AMWG diagnostics plotting packages as part of the CESM run script after the successful completion of the short term archiver
entry.ldesc: If TRUE, this calls the AMWG diagnostics package parallel python wrapper script to generate climatological plots associated with the run job output. See the AMWG diagnostics documentation for more details.

entry.sdesc: logical to call the PCWG diagnostics plotting packages as part of the CESM run script after the successful completion of the short term archiver
entry.ldesc: If TRUE, this calls the PCWG diagnostics package parallel python wrapper script to generate climatological plots associated with the run job output. See the PCWG diagnostics documentation for more details.

entry.sdesc: logical to call the LMWG diagnostics plotting packages as part of the CESM run script after the successful completion of the short term archiver
entry.ldesc: If TRUE, this calls the LMWG diagnostics package parallel python wrapper script to generate climatological plots associated with the run job output. See the LMWG diagnostics documentation for more details.

entry.sdesc: logical to call the OMWG diagnostics plotting packages as part of the CESM run script after the successful completion of the short term archiver
entry.ldesc: If TRUE, this calls the OMWG diagnostics package parallel python wrapper script to generate climatological plots associated with the run job output. See the OMWG diagnostics documentation for more details.

entry.sdesc: Controls whether to generate model vs. observations diagnostics
entry.ldesc: True or false to control if model vs. observations diagnostics are generated.

entry.sdesc: Controls whether to generate model vs. observations ecosystem diagnostics
entry.ldesc: True or false to control if model vs. observatsions ecosystem diagnostics are generated.

entry.sdesc: Controls whether to generate model vs. model diagnostics
entry.ldesc: True or false to control if model vs. model diagnostics are generated. If true, then all OCNDIAG_CNTRL* XML variables will need to be set correctly.

entry.sdesc: Controls whether to generate model vs. model ecosystem diagnostics
entry.ldesc: True or false to control if model vs. model ecosystem diagnostics are generated. If true, then all OCNDIAG_CNTRL* XML variables will need to be set correctly.

entry.sdesc: Controls whether to generate model timeseries diagnostics
entry.ldesc: True or false to control if model timeseries vs. observations diagnostics are generated.

entry.sdesc: Controls whether to generate model ecosystem timeseries diagnostics
entry.ldesc: True or false to control if model timeseries vs. observations ecosystem diagnostics are generated.

entry.sdesc: Controls whether to delete or save intermediate working files on disk
entry.ldesc: Logical to control if working files are deleted (TRUE) or saved (FALSE) after successful completion of generating diagnostics

entry.sdesc: Controls whether extra debugging statements should be displayed in the log file
entry.ldesc: Logical to control if extra debugging statements should be displayed in the log file (TRUE) or not (FALSE).

entry.sdesc: full pathname of OMWG diagnostics log file
Controls whether to create web files or not
entry.ldesc: Logical to control if web html files should be created or not in the WORKDIR location (TRUE) or not (FALSE).

entry.sdesc: Controls whether to append additional web file to existing html or not
entry.ldesc: Logical to control if additional web html files should be appended or not to files in the WORKDIR location (TRUE) or not (FALSE).

entry.sdesc: Specifies number of vertical levels dependent on ocean grid resolution
entry.ldesc: Specifies number of vertical levels used to calculate averages as follows: 62 if using tx0.1v2, 42 if using gx3v7, and 60 otherwise. NOTE: VERTICAL only matters if the vertical levels equals 42; otherwise, it's not used

entry.sdesc: Coupler version depending on version of CESM
entry.ldesc: Options correspond to the following CESM versions: 7b for CESM1.1 or higher, 7 for CCSM4 through CESM1.0.4, and 6 for CCSM3. This setting determines which flux observation file to use.

entry.sdesc: Model start year for diagnostics. NOTE: do not pad with leading zeros
entry.ldesc: Model start year is used to match history time-slice or variable time-series year designations to begin accumulating averages and calculating diagnostic values. If value not set, then defaults to model run job start year as determined by the first monthly history file name.

entry.sdesc: Model end year for diagnostics. NOTE: do not pad with leading zeros
entry.ldesc: Model end year is used to match history time-slice or variable time-series year designations to end accumulating averages and calculating diagnostic values. If value not set, then defaults to model run job end year as determined by the last monthly history file name.

entry.sdesc: Difference between model calendar and physical forcing calendar (for BGC)
Logical to save the annual mean history files.
entry.ldesc: If set to TRUE, then all the annual mean history files will be saved regardless of the POST_CLEANUP setting.

entry.sdesc: contour level options (std, gokhan, gauss)
Comma separated list of integers defining plot x and y ranges in degrees (x0,x1,y0,y1) with ranges [0-360],[0-720],[-90-90],[-90-90]
Comma separated list of depths in kilometers for plot averages.
Specifies whether or not to create plot graphics files
Local machine fully qualified directory path to OMWG diagnostics package.
entry.ldesc: This value points to the local machine's fully qualified directory path location of the OMWG diagnostics package. The ocn_diags_generator.py script will error out if this directory is not available.

entry.sdesc: Local machine fully qualified directory path to OMWG observational data.
entry.ldesc: This value points to the local machine's fully qualified directory path location of the OMWG observational data. The ocn_diags_generator.py script will error out if this directory is not available.

entry.sdesc: Local machine fully qualified directory path to BGCWG observational data.
entry.ldesc: This value points to the local machine's fully qualified directory path location of the BGCWG observational data. The ocn_diags_generator.py script will error out if this directory is not available.

entry.sdesc: Coupler version for control model depends on version of CESM
entry.ldesc: Options correspond to the following CESM versions: 7b for CESM1.1 or higher, 7 for CCSM4 through CESM1.0.4, and 6 for CCSM3. This setting determines which flux observation file to use.

entry.sdesc: Controls whether to create mixed layer depth plots
entry.ldesc: Logical to control whether to create mixed layer depth plots (TRUE) or not (FALSE).

entry.sdesc: Controls whether to create TEMP and SALT at depth plots
entry.ldesc: Logical to control whether to create temperature and salinity on depth surfaces, contours plots (TRUE) or not (FALSE).

entry.sdesc: Controls whether to create passive tracers at depth levels plot
entry.ldesc: Logical to control whether to create passive traces at depth surfaces, contours plots (TRUE) or not (FALSE).

entry.sdesc: Controls whether to create Eulerian velocity at depth levels plot
entry.ldesc: Logical to control whether to create Eulerian velocity (UCEL, VVEL, WVEL) on depth surfaces, contours plots (TRUE) or not (FALSE).

entry.sdesc: Controls whether to create Bolus velocity components at depth levels plot
entry.ldesc: Logical to control whether to create Bolus velocity components on depth surfaces, contours plots (TRUE) or not (FALSE).

entry.sdesc: Controls whether to create diffusion coefficients at depth levels plot
entry.ldesc: Logical to control whether to create diffusion coefficients on depth surfaces, contours plots (TRUE) or not (FALSE).

entry.sdesc: Controls whether to create upperocean at the equator; compared to PHC2, TOGA-TAO plots
entry.ldesc: Logical to control whether to create upperocean at the equator; compared to PHC2, TOGA-TAO plots (TRUE) or not (FALSE).

entry.sdesc: Controls whether to create velocity vector/magnitude at depth levels plots
entry.ldesc: Logical to control whether to create horizontal vector/magnitude fields on depth surfaces, contours plots (TRUE) or not (FALSE).

entry.sdesc: Controls whether to create polar TEMP and SALT at depth levels plots
entry.ldesc: Logical to control whether to create polar TEMP and SALT on depth surfaces, contours plots (TRUE) or not (FALSE).

entry.sdesc: Controls whether to create depth profiles of Basin-average TEMP and SALT plots
entry.ldesc: Logical to control whether to create depth profiles of Basin-average TEMP and SALT plots (TRUE) or not (FALSE).

entry.sdesc: Controls whether to create depth profiles of Regional area-average TEMP and SALT bias and stddev plots
entry.ldesc: Logical to control whether to create depth profiles of Regional area-average TEMP and SALT bias and stddev plots (TRUE) or not (FALSE).
